name: ZX MINES 2
overview: Second part of ZX Mines for Sinclair ZX Spectrum, written in C and ASM to avoid the speed limitations of the original BASIC version. It also has a cover and inlay to make yourself an original tape, and C source code. It has 3 board sizes (like difficulty levels) and Spanish-English messages. Using O, P, Q, A keys we move the cursor over the mine board, and with the space key we unfold the cell under the cursor. If there is a mine, then the game is over, but if it isn't, the computer will show the number of mines that are in the 8 adjacent cells. Using this numbers and being careful, we can unfold every cell without mine, and so beat the game.
